questions.text: Jerry is stuck with his parents over at his apartment.  Where is he sending them for their anniversary?
questions.explanation:
Paris.

	Not only is Jerry angry that his parents are staying at his apartment for three days, but he hasn't been able to see his new girlfriend, Rachel, for three days.  Jerry is glad that George's parents are having the Seinfelds over because he can at least have the apartment to himself for one night.  The Seinfelds end up telling George that they have plans in order to get out of dinner with them because they hate the Costanzas.  The Seinfelds feel that being with the Costanzas would be like being in an asylum.When George tells Alec about the fake Paris trip, Alec says that it's a great idea.  Big Brother has been trying to get Joey, the young boy, to fly to Paris to meet his father for years, and they set George up to take him there.

questions.text: Which character gets involved in the Big Brother program?
questions.explanation:
George.

	When Jerry and George's friend Alec runs into them at the coffee shop with his 'little brother' Joey, he pressures them into joining the Big Brother program.  George falls for the scheme and he persuades the Seinfelds send postcards (while pretending they're from George) to Alec at the Big Brother center.

questions.text: What is the name of the 'close-talker'?
questions.explanation:
Aaron.

	After George leaves Jerry's apartment, Elaine and Aaron come up for a visit.  Jerry describes Aaron as a 'close-talker' because he likes to have conversations while talking right into peoples' faces.  Aaron ends up liking the Seinfelds so much that he spends a lot of time with them.  He hooks them up with tours and French Francs and shows them a good time.

questions.text: What is the name of Morty's raincoat?
questions.explanation:
The Executive.

	The Executive is a belt-less trench coat that Morty invented many years ago.  When Kramer wears one into Jerry's apartment, he tells everyone that they're becoming a hot item.  Morty decides to ship boxes of Executives up from his garage in Florida when Kramer says that he'll get them sold.  He lets Kramer get 25% of the profits and Morty tells Jack Klompus to send up the trench coats.

questions.text: What is the name of Jack Klompus' wife?
questions.explanation:
Doris.

	In order to get the raincoats to New York before they leave for Paris, Morty has Jack Klompus (last seen in the third season episode "The Pen") ship the raincoats up to him by express delivery.  Helen Seinfeld has a feeling that Jack won't ship them up because Jack's wife Doris won't let him.  Jack ends up not being able to send the raincoats early because he can't open the garage.

questions.text: George gets rid of Frank's old clothes.
questions.explanation:
True.

	After learning about this from Kramer, George goes into his parents' attic and gets some boxes of his father's old cabana clothes.  He takes them to a used clothing store and sells three boxes for $225.  It is at this store where he learns that the Seinfelds decided not to have dinner with the Costanzas because they had a spur of the moment dinner with Kramer.  Kramer ends up buying some of those clothes.  When Estelle and Frank decide to go on a cruise, they can't find Frank's cabana clothes.

questions.text: What movie do Jerry and his girlfriend go to see?
questions.explanation:
Schindler's List.

	At the movie theater, Rachel and Jerry don't actually watch the whole movie because they spend the rest of the time kissing.  While kissing, Newman happens to be watching from a higher seat and he tells the Seinfelds.  When Jerry tells Elaine that he made out during "Schindler's List", and when his parents find out about it, they're all shocked.  Jerry's parents end up confronting him and Jerry immediately realizes that Newman was responsible for breaking the news.

questions.text: What type of food does Estelle make for the Seinfelds?
questions.explanation:
Paella.

	Estelle buys the paella in the earlier part of the episode because she assumed that the Seinfelds would be happy to go to their house for dinner.  Throughout the rest of the episode, they're stuck with paella, they assume more and more that the Seinfelds don't like them (which they don't), and the Seinfelds manage to escape a meal with the Costanzas.

questions.text: Do Morty and Helen go on their vacation?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Jack Klompus manages to get into the garage, but only after breaking a window and cutting up his hand.  He ends up sending them with a delivery time in the afternoon because it's ten dollars cheaper, and Morty decides to call off the trip in order to wait for the boxes.  Meanwhile, the Costanzas are confused as to how three boxes of Frank's clothing could go missing.  When Kramer arrives for dinner, he's wearing one of Frank's shirts that he bought at the used clothing store.  George decides to ask Morty and Helen for the tickets to their charter flight in order to deliver the child.

questions.text: What is the name of the kid that George has to travel with?
questions.explanation:
Joey.

	George ends up having a horrible time taking a nuisance to Paris, and when the Seinfelds leave to go back home, Aaron is a bit too attached to them.  Elaine breaks up with him, and when the Seinfelds get home, they find that they have nothing in their house because the Klompuses didn't fix the window.  In the end, the Seinfelds end up on the same cruise that the Costanzas are on and Kramer doesn't manage to sell the raincoats, so they're shipped back to Florida.
